importantDates.descriptionOfWhyDateIsRelevant: The date of the incident involving Doug Martin's arrest and death, which marks a significant event in public safety and law enforcement discourse.

importantTimeframes.descriptionOfWhyTimeFrameIsRelevant: The timeline of Martin’s arrest and death, which highlights the urgency and potential severity of police interactions with individuals during custodial situations.

keyTakeAways: Doug Martin, a former All-Pro NFL running back, died after a brief struggle with police during an arrest for a break-in at a home in Oakland.
Martin was 36 years old at the time of his death and had a distinguished career with the Tampa Bay Buccaneers, including being drafted 31st overall in 2012.
He was recognized as one of the top 50 players in franchise history and was named first-team All-Pro in 2015.
Martin had 5,356 rushing yards and 30 touchdowns over his career, and was selected to the Pro Bowl in 2012 and 2015.
The Oakland Police Department confirmed a 'brief struggle' occurred during the arrest; no further details were released.
An autopsy will determine the cause of death, which has not been publicly disclosed.
The incident has prompted public concern about police interactions with individuals, especially those with prominent public identities.
Martin’s family requested privacy during their mourning, and officials including Oakland Mayor Barbara Lee and the Tampa Bay Buccaneers expressed condolences.

summaryOfNewsArticle: Former NFL star Doug Martin, best known for his time with the Tampa Bay Buccaneers, died after a brief struggle with Oakland Police officers while being taken into custody for a break-in at a home in Oakland. The incident, which occurred early Saturday, led to his hospitalization and death at age 36, with the cause of death still pending an autopsy. Martin had a successful career with the Buccaneers, rushing for over 5,300 yards and 30 touchdowns, earning All-Pro honors and Pro Bowl selections. The Oakland Police Department confirmed a brief struggle during the arrest; no further details were released. The event has prompted public concern about law enforcement interactions with individuals, especially those in the public eye. The Tampa Bay Buccaneers and Oakland Mayor Barbara Lee both issued statements mourning his loss, underscoring his significance both locally and in professional football. The Alameda County Coroner’s Office will conduct a full autopsy to determine the cause of death.
title: Former NFL Player Doug Martin Dies After Police Detention
